text:
Hi. I have been struggling to get my resize_image_url to do anything. After seeing some recent community posts, I tried supplying two additional booleans. Now my images are successfully being resized (from 5000+px wide uploaded source).
e.g.
{{ resize_image_url(module.image.src, 0, 640, 0, true, true) }}

Anybody know what these two 'true' values are? Why isn't this documented anywhere, or am I looking in the wrong place?
And I am assuming I still can't crop images, just resize them
As per documentation, images that are larger than 4096px won't be resized <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/files/automatic-image-resizing-on-HubSpot-content>
Ah, ok thanks. Strange that I can override this by supplying these two additional values.
The `resize_image_url()` function is documented here with reference to those booleans <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#resize-image-url>

anyone else get put on the new beta for website pages? I’m having problems with the UI - mainly that the feedback button doesn’t do anything, and why have a button that says “learn more about the beta” that doesn’t teach you anything — here is a video: <https://share.getcloudapp.com/eDu7ZeyO>
Just ran into the new layout while working on a client blog - the left sidebar is missing completely, it's the way the pages are presented on the page.
instead of looking like this
it's all at the top
yup, and content staging is in the more tools dropdown….. my website page is now frozen and pinwheeling so I haven’t gotten into the analyze dropdown yet.
oh, I didn't even think of how you would get to content staging from this view, looking now...

I’m not sure why they got rid of the sidebar — the sidebar would have been useful if you didn’t have to click “more tools” to show content staging. I’m guessing this is so they can display more data in the table I’m thinking, which will be perfect, but making a collapsible sidebar would have been a better move vs creating a few different drop-downs that need to be clicked
it's up here now
I think it is because of the pending navigation change - there is a private beta, it is all sidebar based, so having a sidebar on a page already would not work so great
and when I say pending, I don't mean any time soon
moving the navigation from the top to the sidebar? lol dm me a screenshot?

If they remove the “takeover” of the menu and allow the menu to be accessible inside certain items like the page editor, then I’m for whatever it is — as having to duplicate my page editor, to exit the page editor so I can get back to the menu is terrible
<@U25PYL3Q8> or <@U03AKL6Q1B2> did you happen to see a way to organize website or landing pages into folders in this new Beta version?
i’ll check real quick Kevin,,, just a moment
no, but you can add a view
it's kind of like a filtered view in contacts
<@U03AKL6Q1B2> so you can add a tag or some property to a website page than you can use to Add a View?
it looks like these are the only options for website page
Thanks for looking into that for me.  I appreciate it.
no problem, blog is the same, except with the usual blog properties too
LOL thanks Jennifer — I finally got my google chrome restarted and then couldn’t remember what portal I was in!
ooh - wait, look what I found
If you check an LP
If I click Move to folder, home is the only option and it looks like it is based on the "site tree"
I can't find anywhere to actually create a folder though
